definition: suitable/to one's liking/to get along together
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
erhua variant of 不對勁|不对劲[bu4 dui4 jin4]
erhua variant of 對勁|对劲[dui4 jin4]

sentences.english: This hoe suits me very well .
sentences.chinese: 這把鋤我使着很對勁兒。

sentences.english: We are delighted with your products and are thinking of placing an order.
sentences.chinese: 我們對你方的產物很是對勁，正欲訂購。

sentences.english: The soup that I ordered yesterday did not taste as it should.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我叫的湯，味道好像不對勁。

sentences.english: They have been getting along quite well.
But there seems something wrong in the rugby this year.
sentences.chinese: 但是今年的橄欖球賽好象有點不對勁。

sentences.english: I could sense that there was something wrong. It felt wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我能感覺出一些不對，它不對勁。
但是有些事看起來好像不太對勁。

sentences.english: But in the past decade, something went horribly wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但在過去十年，事情變得不對勁了。

sentences.english: Once we started questioning her, things didn’t add up.
sentences.chinese: 一旦我們開始詢問她，就發現事情不對勁了。

sentences.english: I feel that he is kind of grouchy today.
sentences.chinese: 我隱約感到他今天不太對勁。

sentences.english: Ann, look at Lily, she is not in harmony.
sentences.chinese: 安，你看莉莉，她好像有點不大對勁。

sentences.english: Nothing smells a rat. I told you that he's an all-right guy.
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼不對勁的，我告訴你他是一個很好的小夥子。

sentences.english: He quickly ran home, looking as if there was something wrong with him.
sentences.chinese: 他快步跑回家，看上去好象有什麼事不對勁。

sentences.english: I don’t want to say he steals them, but I really smell a rat.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我不想說他偷我的書，但我確實覺得不對勁。

sentences.english: If you feel weird about something tell him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你感到有些事情不對勁，那就跟他直說。
